# Government Tender Announcement: Composite Aluminum Panels and Insulation

## Project Information

- **Reference Number**: PW-23-01030150
- **Solicitation Number**: 21C82-22-4100483/A
- **Publication Date**: March 15, 2023
- **Tender Closing Date**: March 31, 2023, 17:00:00

## Project Description

The Correctional Service of Canada has issued a tender for the supply and installation of composite aluminum panels, wall cladding, insulation (exterior) with vapor barrier, and preformed aluminum soffit for a renovation project at the Mission Minimum Institution in British Columbia.

## Objective and Requirements

The scope of work includes renovations and adding a new addition to the existing building, with a total footprint area of 25.8m2. Suppliers must provide all necessary labor, materials, tools, equipment, transportation, and supervision for the project, including installing flashing for vertical seismic expansion joints and submitting shop drawings for review and approval prior to fabrication.

## Tendering Procedure

This is a two-phase tender process. In Phase One, bidders are required to submit a bid according to the specified procedure, with the option to resubmit only Phase Two documents if the initial bid is not successful. In Phase Two, bidders will submit a final bid, and the successful supplier will be selected based on the lowest-priced compliant bid.

## Tender Details

- **Trade Agreement**: Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA)
- **Regions of Opportunity**: British Columbia
- **Regions of Delivery**: British Columbia
- **Estimated Quantity**: See solicitation document statement of work and basis of payment
- **Duration of Contract and Time Frame for Delivery**: Six weeks from the date of notification of acceptance of the offer

## Contact Information

- **Contracting Authority**: Sandra Wilford
- **Email**: Sandra.Wilford@csc-scc.gc.ca
- **Phone**: 604.557.3004

## Additional Information

 Suppliers can obtain the complete tender document and evaluation criteria by visiting the Canadabuys website. After contract award, bidders may request a debriefing on the results of the bid solicitation process. Procurement Assistance Canada offers free seminars to businesses interested in selling goods and services to the Government of Canada.
